channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-10508] Strip out password information from config passed to Tez/MR in cases where password encryption is not used
item.description: Remove password information from configuration copy that is sent to Yarn/Tez. We don't need it there. The config entries can potentially be visible to other users.
item.summary: Strip out password information from config passed to Tez/MR in cases where password encryption is not used

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
vikram.dixit Can you look at this patch and let me know if there are any other places in hive where we might unnecessarily send password information to Tez/Yarn jobs.
cc-ing thejas for review.

Thanks
Hari

Thanks for the patch Hari!

  1. Looks like additional changes would be needed for the MR case
  2. Setting the value to null would result in an error. See Configuration.set. Maybe set to emtpy string instead ? If I remember right there was not a good way to remove the configuration that works in both 1.x and 2.x .
  3. conf.setVar(HiveConf.ConfVars.METASTOREPWD, null) is more concise/readable than - HiveConf.setVar(conf, HiveConf.ConfVars.METASTOREPWD, null);

thejas Thanks for the review.
1. Made changes in MR job conf as well
2. Changed the value to empty string
3. conf.setVar() is not possible since conf is a jobconf. I can use conf.set(HiveConf.ConfVars.METASTOREPWD.name(), "") . However, I stuck with HiveConf.setVar() since it is used in other places in the same file.
Please let me know if you think I need to change this.
Added this to sparkTask as well in patch#3

I am able to reproduce the issue related to SparkCliDriver locally which goes away once I undo the change in SparkTask. After all, it might be true that Hive on Spark requires this information or I should be making the change elsewhere in spark code path. I am reverting the change in SparkTask.
cc-ing thejas.

Thanks
Hari
